intro: Strobilanthes orthostachya, commonly known as the "Copperleaf," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking copper-colored foliage. The plant produces showy, spike-like inflorescences with tubular flowers that are often visited by bees and other pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses around the world.
